fields.label: bd2
fields.options: STARLIGHT HOME CARE ENTERPRISE RISK MANAGEMENT APPROACH

fields.label: bd3
fields.options:
Starlight Home Care has adopted the ORCA Approach to ensure consistent application of risk management by all staff, in the:

  • execution of 3 years strategic plan,
  • achievement of business objectives, and
  • day-to-day operations.


ORCA represents:
O OBJECTIVES
Goals and results that Starlight Home Care aims to achieve
R RISKS
Any potential event which could prevent the achievement of an objective
C CONTROL
Management’s response to risks
A ALIGNMENT
Alignment of Starlight Home Care objectives, risks and controls across the enterprise determined by its appetites and tolerances for risks

fields.label: bd4
fields.options:
Risk Assessment Template (Physical Disability Participant)


Risk Assessment Scope

fields.label: bd5
fields.options: Describe the activity / task: Physical Disability participant

fields.label: bd6
fields.options: Live alone Participant Sole Worker Risk Factor

fields.label: Is the participant receiving support or services from any other NDIS provider that involve regular, face-to-face contact
Without the assistance of another person the participant has limited or no physical mobility
The participant uses equipment to enable them to be physically mobile or to facilitate their physical mobility
Without the assistance of another person the participant has limited or no ability to communicate with others
The participant uses equipment to enable or facilitate communication with others, including to enable or facilitate the use of a phone or ot
Does the participant have a history of abuse/trauma; family violence (victim) or exploitation?
Does the participant have a history of financial difficulties?
Does the participant have a history of homelessness?
Does the participant have a history of substance use?
Does the participant have a history of violence/aggression, assault, family violence, criminal charges?
Does the participant have a history of prior sex offending, incident assault, and/or experiencing abuse/sexual abuse?
Does the participant have a history of frequent hospital admission?
Does the participant have a vision and/or hearing impairment?
Does the participant have a history of falling?
In Home Care – Is there a first aid kit available in the home.
Is there assistive equipment available to support participant in the home for personal care
Is the bathroom big enough to shower the participant
Are there any steps or barriers to move in the bathroom
Is there assistive equipment available in participant home for toilet use
Is there safety mats (anti slip) available in bathroom/ toilet
Is the floor surface of the bathroom damaged?
Sink: is there sufficient space for participant wheelchair to move around the sink
Is there sufficient space in the bathroom to dress up the participant?
Is there safe passage between the bathroom and the room.
Is the assistive equipment and mobility equipment regularly maintained / repaired?
Is the floor surface of the bathroom damaged?
Is there enough lighting in the bathroom?
Any tripping hazards inside bathroom / shower area?
Has there been any past incidents during personal care delivery?
Are there contrast strips when surface levels change?
Electrical equipment – any electrical equipment that is damaged? Inc. cables
Is there any damage to gas powered equipment (inc. damage to gas pipes/ gas leaks)
Sharps management procedure, is there a safe place to store sharps?
Are there any cables laying around the kitchen area?
Is there a fire blanket or a fire extinguisher in home?
Is the cleaning equipment in participant’s home safe to use/ not damaged?
Are there gloves available for staff to wear while using chemicals?
Are there any tripping hazards in the areas that require cleaning?
Is there safe transport available for the participant? E.g. wheelchair accessing vehicle?
Is there equipment available to TRANSFER participant from wheelchair into the car and vice versa?
If participants vehicle is being used, is the vehicle insured and fit to drive on road and registered?
If participants vehicle is being used, is the vehicle being regularly serviced/ maintained?
Is road side assistance available n participant’ vehicle?
Training on participant’s vehicle for loading and unloading of wheelchair.
Is the community participation activity safe for participant?
Is there suitable accessibility for the participant to access the destination?
Is the destination overcrowded for participant?
Is there a toilet facility at the destination? And is accessible?
Does the activity require a detailed risk assessment?
Is there an animal related risk to participant? (participant is scared of dogs etc?)
Does the participant require a detailed behaviour risk assessment?
Are there any tripping risks at the destination?
Has the participant done this activity before?
Does the participant require a trained support staff in this particular activity?
Is there any assistive equipment required to support participant in this activity?
Are there any tripping hazards in this activity?
Do we have an OT or qualified Personal Trainer assessment for participant to be involved in this activity?
Can this activity cause any trauma or complication to participant (e.g. contact sports causing reminder of an injury)?
Does this activity require a detailed risk assessment?
Does the participant has previous experience of non-compliance with medication?
Is there a medication management plan developed by a health professional (GP, RN or hospital)?
Is there a safe place to store medication in the participant’s home?
Is the support staff trained in management of medication?

fields.label: capbod
fields.options:
Controls Assurance Program (CAP)

For each proposed Risk Control, provide a recommended action and allocate a responsible person and time frame in consultation with that person. Completion confirmation is required for each action.

fields.label: Control measures have been reviewed and no further risks have been identified
